description.@value: No meat for your chili? No problem, not with this recipe that will show you how to make the best instant pot vegetarian chili that Iâve ever tried. What it lacks in meat, it makes up for with flavor and texture thanks to the fresh garden veggies, savory herbs, and fiery hot spices. Youâll be making it with everything from onion, garlic, mushrooms, bell peppers, carrots, and sweet potatoes, so itâs still incredibly filling and of course, since itâs full of vegetables, you get a wide variety of vitamins and minerals, not to mention fiber as well. Save this recipe the next time you want to change up your meat-based dishes.

name.@value: The Best Instant Pot Vegetarian Chili (Spicy, Rich and Hearty)

recipeIngredient.@value: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced

itemListElement.@value: Press the SAUTE button on the Instant pot and let stand until screen reads âHOTâ.
Turn the venting knob to SEALING and press PRESSURE COOK button.
Close and seal the Instant pot.
Add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes.
When finished cooking, quick-release pressure according to manufacturerâs directions.
Add the sliced mushrooms and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Top with your favorite toppings (sliced jalapeno, avocado, extra cilantro etcâ¦) and serve.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Add the carrots, celery, bell peppers, chili powder, cumin, oregano, basil, sweet potato and diced tomatoes and mix to combine.
Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
